entry.title: Being an SAP Champion: A Journey of Growth and Connection
entry.content:
Becoming an SAP Champion has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my professional journey. Not only because it represents recognition for the work I’ve been doing, but especially because it has connected me even more deeply with a community that transforms, inspires, and empowers.

To me, the SAP community has always been a space of continuous learning. It’s where professionals from different fields and experience levels come together to exchange ideas, share solutions, and, above all, build together. Actively participating in this network has been essential for both my technical and personal development.

 SAP Inside Track São Paulo - 2025

The knowledge shared through forums, webinars, study groups, and events like SAP Inside Track is truly transformative. It’s in these gatherings that we witness, in practice, the power of networking and collaboration. Every story shared, every challenge overcome together reinforces how much stronger we are when we walk side by side.

Becoming a Champion has brought me even greater visibility and responsibility. It’s inspiring to contribute to the growth of others, support those who are just starting, encourage the exchange of experiences, and promote initiatives that strengthen the community. At the same time, I’m constantly inspired by the talent, generosity, and passion of the professionals who make up this ecosystem.

I believe the strength of the SAP community goes far beyond technology. It lies in the connection between people. In the genuine desire to grow and make a difference. In mutual support. And in every small act of collaboration that turns into meaningful personal, professional, and even social progress.

If today I feel more prepared, more connected, and more fulfilled, I owe a great deal to this journey within the community. And I continue with enthusiasm, contributing, learning, and giving back everything it has given me.

SAP Inside Track Fortaleza organizing team and family attending SITSP

entry.title: Re: advanced ATP for third party sales orders
entry.content:
If your material is already flagged as a third-party item (e.g. item category TAN with third-party processing), it may not be treated as a candidate for substitution. ABC is designed to substitute ATP-relevant materials, typically NORM-type materials, with third-party sourcing options. The substitution logic assumes the original item is a stock item that can be replaced with a third-party sourced variant.
If you ask why item category be TAN instead of TAS is because, TAN representing a stocked product. When aATP identifies a substitute that is sourced externally, it creates a CB1/CBAB subitem, which is processed as a third-party item, but only after substitution. So what you can do is test a material with NORM and see how it works

entry.title: Emarsys promotion in fail safe mode - alert notification
entry.content:
Hi,  

We have had a promotion automation which was put into 'failsafe mode'.  We can see in the notification centre that we can set up notifications for this scenario, however, we need to send an email to a specific end point to connect to our pager duty out of hours support tool.  This would be a global setting for any campaign or promotion automation that goes into failsafe mode - so that we can alert IT to investigate and initiate discussions with SAP.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Emarsys promotion in fail safe mode - alert notification
entry.content:
Hello,

 

In order to receive failsafe notifications via email, you can toggle the option "Also in email" at the notification center. You can enable this option for all notifications or only for the automation programs, if you prefer so.

You can check how to perform this change in details at SAP Emarsys Help: The Notification Center. This email message will be sent to the same contacts that receive the notification inside Emarsys itself.

 

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Conflict Between Employee Master cost center Defaults and Work Center in CATS Cost Posting
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We are using the CATS timesheet to book time against project network activities.
We have configured the default master cost center using the Organizational Assignment Infotype (0001) in the CATS Data Entry Profile, and maintained the pricing in KP26 for the relevant activity type.
(Reference: SAP Note 333884 – "Which default values are used when?")
However, during time booking via CAT2 for network activities, the system checks for a Work Center. To avoid dependency on operational Work Centers, we created a dummy Work Center without assigning a cost center or activity type.
Issue
When this setup is used, no actual cost is posted to the project, even though pricing is available for the employee’s cost center and activity type via IT0001 and KP26.
To test further, we assigned minimal pricing by maintaining a dummy cost center and activity type in the Work Center. This allowed actual cost posting — and the system still picked the pricing from the Infotype 0001 cost center and activity type.
This leads to confusion:
• Why is maintaining cost center and activity type in the Work Center mandatory if the actual pricing is still derived from the employee master data?
• Is this the standard system behavior in S/4HANA?
Concern:
Maintaining pricing data (KP26) for dummy Work Centers introduces additional effort and unnecessary maintenance


Regards,

SarfaraZ

PLM Project System (PS) SAP Timesheet

entry.title: Re: Check Manager Settings in CCM
entry.content:
Hi @SatwikJoshi99, 

Here is the explanation provided by SAP for Check Manager: 

Additional Checks for Settlement Run

The system performs several standard checks and checks based on configuration settings whether a settlement can be performed for a condition contract, for the specified settlement date, and the settlement type.

Examples for simple checks are that a condition contract must have status Released, it may not have a settlement lock and the condition contract has yet not been settled for a specific settlement date.

An example for a configuration setting is parameter Requirement Next Settlement Allowed of the condition contract type that controls which status the settlement documents for previous settlement dates need to have, so that the settlement run for the next settlement date can be performed.
With the Check Manager tool you can configure additional checks whether a settlement run is allowed.

Prerequisite

You have to create global ABAP classes in the class pool which implement the additional checks.
To specify additional checks in the Check Manager tool, choose Customizing activity Checks for Settlement Run in the Check Manager .

To resume is for additional and custom check at the settlement document creation, change or release to accounting you would like to implement.
For example: check the amount of accrual match or => rebates/commissions/royalties, if not throw an error message
Check the profit center is determined, if not throw an error message...

Application Status (check manager) SAP definition, quite explicit: 

Check Manager: Skip Checks

The Setting controls if checks have to be performed for documents with this specific application status or settlement block.

Use

Check Manager

Example

Manually blocked documents should not be checked, because this happens on release and will possibly cause a status change to an error status.

Application log (check manager) SAP definition, quite explicit: 

Check Manager: Keep Application Logs

If this flag is set, all application logs remain in the system until archived.
Otherwise only the last protocol for each document application log object/subobject is kept.

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Re: Implementação da NT 2024.003
entry.content:
Bom dia,

Para os dados de guia de trânsito, usei a BADI J_1BNF_ADD_DATA, no método ADD_DATA, usando a estrutura ES_HEADER, nos campos TPGUIA, UFGUIA, SERIEGUIA e NGUIA.

Já para o Receituário e o CPF, usei o mesmo método, adicionando na tabela ET_AGRI_DEFEN, nos campos COUNTER, NRECEITUARIO e CPFRESPTEC.

No meu caso, criei uma aba customizada na remessa para serem informados esses campos e já irem para a nota fiscal depois do faturamento. O único problema agora é a TAG AGROPECUARIO no XML que não está aparecendo.

entry.title: Access to Historical Production Orders incl. BOMs after S4 Cloud Migration – Feasible Approach?
entry.content:
Hi all,

We're currently preparing a system transition to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for a midsize manufacturing company. One key requirement raised by the Sales Back Office is:

“Historical production orders (including materials, BOMs, and production data) must remain fully traceable – especially to track past configurations and spare parts.”

We are not planning a full migration of legacy production data, but we still need a reliable, user-friendly way to access historical information from the new system.

Key questions to the community:

  1. What are your proven approaches to ensure traceability of historical production orders – even without full migration?
    Any experience with read-only data access through SAP BTP, standalone HANA DB or custom UIs?

  2. Have you implemented deep-linking or referencing between current S/4HANA Public Cloud transactions and archived legacy data (SAP ECC or non-SAP)?
    How does it work in practice – especially in terms of authorization, UX and responsiveness?

  3. Has anyone successfully enabled BOM traceability and structure navigation from current orders or service cases back into historical orders?
    If so, would you be willing to share key design considerations or technical architecture?

Context:

  • Target system: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Source system: SAP ECC 6.0

  • Legacy data: Should remain accessible but not fully migrated

Any insights, architecture sketches or war stories are highly appreciated!

Best regards
Christian

entry.title: Re: can we maintain the budget restriction using WBS elem...
entry.content:
Hi Ken,

Thanks for your response! 

Yes, I agree with you that the commitment for a PR will consume budget as long as the PR is account assigned to the WBS element. But in case of plant maintenance, we select WBS element and cost centre in Plant maintenance order. The Budget check should happen at the maintenance order level or the PR level( What usually happens in other case with account assignment as 'P' which is Project where we can assign a WBS element). Where as in the case where a PR is generated w.r.t a plant maintenance order, the account assignment type is 'F' which is order. And in this the WBS element is not there under account assignment so the system is unable to check the budget at PR level. 

The business requirement is that they need budget check for plant maintenance orders while they create a Plant maintenance order or it will suffice the requirement on PR level as well. Please suggest how this requirement can be fulfilled.

Regards,

Arun

entry.title: Interface Execution Summary/Exception Alert for Logging/Monitoring and Debugging
entry.content:
Use case - As part of debugging/monitoring, commonly used approach is sending mail alert in exception sub process to the application maintenance team (here in refer as AM Team). Also, sending a success execution summary mail with relevant interface details is send across to AM team or user depending on business requirement.

Challenge - Tracer logs data for 10mins and at near real-time. In cases where AM team needs more data for debugging post runtime execution, info level data in the monitoring log is not adequate for debugging. In complex interfaces with modular flows and process directs, tracing the flow execution gets consuming.

Approach - Keeping above points in thought, below is solution which I have applied in my design which is reusable. It is combination of below -

  • groovy script
  • custom header
  • content modifier

Implementation - 

1. Content Modifier - Set a variable with a custom text message according to your iflow logic. Key is to - set a logical text message which assist the Developer or AM Team to understand - which logic checkpoint is cleared or failed and why. This text message will appear in custom header and also in mail. One can set Content Modifier in Router branches, LIP, Exception subprocess, Multicast branches, before/after request reply call etc. as seem suited.

I am using variable - 'FlowExecutionStatusMsg' in Content modifier and Groovy script 

2. Below is the reusable Groovy Script which you can place in script collection or use locally in iflow. This needs to be placed in Exception Subprocess for Mail Alert and also at end of iflow for Interface Execution Summary Mail (optional). It captures the camel exception and runtime properties, headers and payload along with the custom text message set in the flow at the runtime.

/* Title - GS_InterfaceExecutionSummary.groovyscript.                  Objective - Groovy Script For Interface Execution Summary Mail ; captures runtime error, headers, properties and payload.
*/

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
//import groovy.json.JsonOutput
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

Message processData(Message message) {
   
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
      
      //get message components
      def body = message.getBody(String)
    def headers = message.getHeaders()
    def properties = message.getProperties()
   
    // Sort headers and properties alphabetically
    def sortedHeaders = headers.sort { it.key }
    def sortedProperties = properties.sort { it.key }

    // Get timestamp in system timezone (runtime)
    def sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z")
    def currentTimestamp = sdf.format(new Date())
   
    //for attachment file
    def label = "FlowLog_" + currentTimestamp.replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "-")
   
      // get custom logger details from flow
      def FlowExecutionStatusMsg = properties.get("FlowExecutionStatusMsg") ?: "Not Set"
    def Iflow_Name = properties.get("Iflow_Name") ?: "Not Set"
    def MPL_id = properties.get("SAP_MessageProcessingLogID") ?: "Not Set"

    // Exception
    def exceptionRaw = properties.get("CamelExceptionCaught")
    def exceptionDetails = ""
    if (exceptionRaw)
      {
        def exMsg = exceptionRaw.getMessage() ?: exceptionRaw.toString()
        def exType = exceptionRaw.getClass().getSimpleName()
        exceptionDetails = """

Exception Type: ${exType}
Message       : ${exMsg}

Stack Trace:
${exceptionRaw.toString()}
"""
    } else {
        exceptionDetails = "--- NO Exception Captured ---"
    }

    // Start of Build HTML body
    def html = new StringBuilder()
    html.append("<html><body>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Hello Team,</strong></p>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Kindly find Interface Execution Summary below :</strong></p>")
   
  //summary table start 
      html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Name: </b></td><td> ${Iflow_Name}</td></tr>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Execution CustomLogMessage :</b></td><td> ${FlowExecutionStatusMsg}</td></tr>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>MPL ID :</b></td><td> ${MPL_id}</td></tr>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>Timestamp:</b></td><td> ${currentTimestamp}</td></tr>")
    html.append("<tr><td><b>Refer to Attachment in SAP IS Monitoring : FileName - </b></td><td> ${label}</td></tr>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>Exception Details : </b></td><td> ${exceptionDetails} </td></tr>")
      html.append("<tr><td><b>Message Payload Body At Runtime Step: </b></td><td> ${body} </td></tr>")
      html.append("</table><br>")
//summary table end

//start of properties table
    html.append("<h4>Exchange Properties</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Property Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedProperties.each
      { k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//end of properties table

//headers start table
    html.append("<h4>Message Headers</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Header Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedHeaders.each
      { k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//headers end table
   
    html.append("<p>Kindly Do Not Reply to this auto-generated mail.Please contact SAP-Integration Support Team for further investigation.</p>")
    html.append("<p>Regards,<br> SAP CPI Admin</p>")    

    html.append("</body></html>")

    // Note - Set Mail Adapter MIME type to "text/html"
    def logMessage = html.toString()
    message.setBody(logMessage)
   
    // Log Attachment + Custom Header Property
    if (messageLog != null)
    {
    messageLog.addAttachmentAsString(label, logMessage, "text/html")
    messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("FlowExecutionStatusMsg", FlowExecutionStatusMsg)
    }
    message.setProperty("MailLogBody", logMessage)
   
    return message
}

Below are steps/code snippets and configuration need to be done in the interface -

Add Custom text message (logically for your debugging/monitoring) as per the Interface flow. 

Add Iflow name which acts as identifier in complex mutliple flows development and will be displayed in mail too.

Mail configuration: I have used externalization for ease of code transport. 

Configure From, To, Subject with specific details.

Mail body has the value set by the groovy output, which would be visible in the outlook mail.

In Monitoring tab, Custom Header below will reflect the custom text message set in the content modifier.

The attachment Flow log with the timestamp is set by the groovy script and would be visible in Monitoring tab for later debugging. It would have the runtime execution details.

The Mail body would consist of below details - Summary table, Properties and Headers. (I have scrubbed data for usage) 

This can be altered in the groovy script as per one's use case requirement. 

Hope this assist you in smoother debugging. 

P.S - This is my first blog despite spending a decade in Integration space, hope to invest time and effort consciously in blogging henceforth after project implementations going forth. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Default Output GST Tax Code by Warehouse Code in Sale...
entry.content:
Hi,

Use below FMS query

SELECT DISTINCT 'ZR' FROM RDR1 T0 WHERE $[$38.24.11] = 'HQ'

Note: Change tax code ZR to your code and ware house code HQ to your warehouse.

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled aut...
entry.content:
Hi Felix14,

handling units (HU) in repetitive manufacturing or discrete/process manufacturing does not have direct reference to a sales order. See also reply from Lakshmipathi.

If you create a planned HU in transaction MFP1, then sales order reference is not supported.

But if you create a realized HU in transaction MFP2/MFP22, then you get the sales order reference under certain circumstances.
Refer to SAP note https://me.sap.com/notes/2524903 "MFP22: Posting the HUs to the sales order stock"
Once you created a HU in transaction MFP22, then there is a flag/check box "sales order stock". If this check box is set and you press the button "Confirm HU (online)", then you navigate to transaction MFHU and here the sales order is filled. See attached screenshot.

The transaction MFHU is a multifunctional transaction, so all fields are available, even if they aren't needed for some actions.

I hope that this reply is helpful for you.

Best regards,
Barış

Nagarajan

entry.title: The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
As mentioned in the External Blog Post Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications, SAP Analytics Cloud has been in a phased approached to transition customers to the Optimized Experience.

With the 2025 Q3 QRC, SAP Analytics Cloud is entering its next phase. It reinforces our commitment to delivering a modern, high-performance, and consistent user experience within Business Data Cloud (BDC).

What’s Changing?

With this phase, customers will no longer be able to create new Classic Stories or Analytic Applications. For example, clicking on a new Canvas or Responsive Page in the Stories Module will now automatically launch the Optimized Story Experience instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience. It ensures that all new content benefits from the performance, usability, and functional improvements available.

  • 🔒 Creation of New Classic Stories and Applications is now DISABLED
  • ✅ Existing Classic Assets (Stories and Analytic Application) remain EDITABLE and FULLY MAINTAINABLE

Continued Access to Existing Classic Assets

Even though new content creation in classic is disabled, existing Classic Stories and Analytic Applications can still be maintained. Our definition of maintainable includes:

  • View, Edit, and Save Content
  • Share, Duplicate, and Delete

⚠️ Continued access to Classic Assets remains until the full deprecation in the 2026 Q2 QRC where these assets will no longer be accessible. It means that customers should begin the migration to the Optimized Experience prior to this date.

Enhancements to File Repository and Object Management

With this phase, we’ve made several usability improvements in how assets are presented and managed:

  • Visual Distinction: The File Repository now provides a clear visual distinction between Classic and Optimized Stories as well as Analytical Applications
  • (Deprecated) Labeling: Deprecated object types now include a “(Deprecated)” suffix in their type
  • Granular Filtering: Object Type Filtering now has more granularity to filter between Classic Stories (Deprecated), Analytical Applications (Deprecated), and Stories

 

Streamlining the User Interface

We’ve taken additional steps to simplify the user experience by removing entry points that led to these deprecated assets. For example:

  • Analytic Applications module no longer has a create button. It still displays the most recent Analytic Applications.
  • Stories module no longer has Smart Discovery or Grid Pages as selectable tiles
  • Clicking Canvas, Responsive, or Template now opens the Optimized Story instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience
  • Modeller module no longer has a Point of Interest Tab to create new Point of Interests
  • Actions from a Model to Create a new Canvas or Responsive opens the Optimized Story

 

Increasing Awareness for the Designer

Within the Classic Experience (Stories and Analytic Applications), we’ve increased the severity of our Deprecation Warning to a Deprecation Notice. It appears in a more prominent indicator reminding the Designer that the Classic Asset will be disabled starting mid-2026. This warning is only shown to Story Designers, the users best positioned to initiate migration.

 

Preparing for Full Deprecation in 2026

This phase marks a significant milestone in our journey toward unifying and modernizing the SAP Analytics Cloud experience. We encourage all customers to begin or continue transitioning their Classic Stories and Analytic Applications to the Optimized Experience before the 2026 Q2 QRC to avoid any disruption. There are a few resources that we recommend.

Mass Migration Tool

With the 2024 Q4 QRC, we had released a Mass Migration Tool for Designers to migrate up to 50 assets to the Optimized Experience. There are a few steps that are involved which includes:                                              

  1. Selection of Assets
  2. Conversion Check & Status
  3. Conversion Settings
  4. Conversion Summary

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to the Optimized Experience

Mass Deletion Tool for System Admins

With the 2025 Q2 QRC, within the System Overview – Housekeeping, we had introduced an option for System Administers to delete specific objects, without the need of manual deletion object by object. There is a Last Access Date which helps System Administrators understand which objects are not actively used. 

But it doesn’t stop there. In addition to the primary object, all dependent objects are also automatically deleted. It means you no longer need to worry about unnecessary and unused objects adding up in your system and slowing down its performance.

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Efficient Data Maintenance in SAP Analytics Cloud System Overview - Housekeeping

⚠️ For Stories we do not support the distinction between Classic and Optimized Experience. It will be made available in a future release.

Resources

  • Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications
  • Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to Optimized Experience
  • The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (includes Blended Table)
  • Optimized Experience Restrictions & Discontinued Features
  • Mass Deletion Tool for System Administrators

entry.title: Re: Prevent empty version columns in table for version‐re...
entry.content:
@Eliram_Lugassi 

If you have both the restricted measures and the version in the Table axis, this behavior is as expected. It will create a cartesian combination of both restricted measures with all versions. Ideally if you are restricting the measure with a version , you should not be having version dimension also in the axis. Just enable the constant selection feature in the restricted measure. Once you have the version restricted as constant selection you can get rid of the version dimension. If you need to keep both then you need to do some Advance Filtering.

 

Nikhil

In ME2L itself, you have the option to filter based on Selection Parameter which should be WEIN, so that this will display POs with both GR and invoice postings. Once the report displays check the below two columns and you can conclude that

  • Invoice Document Number: If populated, the PO has been invoiced.

entry.title: Re: Where to control when the accrual calendar runs? Accr...
entry.content:
Hi @laurasanchezf 

For accrual automation, "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" is used execute the accrual automation without any manual action.

In the required time account, if you are setting "Level Of Accrual Automation" drop down as "Automatic Accrual Creation" then you have to maintain value in "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]". 

Example 

1. if you need to auto-accrue the time account for every future years on 01st Jan then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "1"

2. For 2026, if you need to auto-accrue the time account in 01st June 2025 then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "-183". 

Above requirement can be configured based on the business requirement. 

To configure the accrual posting date, you have to customise the "Accrual Rule" mapped in the time account type. 

Considering your example:- "Accrual to happen six months after the validity of my annual account"  - for this requirement, you have work only on the posting date. Refer the below screenshot.

Recommend to try the use cases/scenario in test environment. If it is working as per the expectation then deploy it in production.

Thanks

Arun

entry.title: Re: We have a requirement to schedule all existing batch jobs using bgRFC. Is it possible
entry.content: For the first and last questions: background jobs are used to run heavy tasks as there is no timeout (no time limit). They may start immediately or at scheduled time or after other jobs (during lesser activity e.g. the night). RFC is to start some small tasks immediately or as soon as possible, on the same system or on a remote system. It's better suited for parallelization. Background jobs may also start small units of work in RFC. RFC has timeout. Depending on each requirement, choose one or the other, it's non-sense to start all in background or all in bgRFC.don't

CNT1:=0;
IF :OBJECT_TYPE='7' AND (:TRANSACTION_TYPE='A' OR  :TRANSACTION_TYPE='U') THEN
 
 
 
select count("CardCode") INTO CNT1 from ospp ---TO_NVARCHAR(CURRENT_TIME, 'HH24:MI')
where ifnull("U_LeadBy",'')=''  and ifnull("ItemCode",'')<>'' and ("ItemCode"||"CardCode")=:list_of_cols_val_tab_del ;
 IF :CNT1>0 THEN
        ERROR := 122;
       ERROR_MESSAGE := 'pls updateU_LeadBy ';
     END IF;
END IF;

entry.title: Re: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
On your comment, “reward only if 2025 sales exceed 2024 by 15%”, YoY growth-based rebates are not directly supported. You’ll need to simulate the growth logic using custom condition base values or enhancement. Try the below approach

Create Two Condition Contracts; one for Contract A (Base Year – 2024) where you can capture actual sales volume and Contract B (Target Year – 2025) to define rebate condition with a threshold.  These two condition types to be inserted to your existing pricing procedure which is related to CCM or you can copy the existing PP and create a new PP where you can add these two condition types.

Use Custom Condition Base Value Routine via VOFM to calculate

  • 2025 sales volume
  • Compare it to 2024 volume
  • Apply rebate only if growth > 15%

Use a percentage-based condition (e.g., 5% rebate). Apply it only to the incremental volume exceeding the 15% threshold. Run periodic settlement or final settlement to generate credit memos. Use delta accruals if needed to adjust monthly postings.

If you are not a SD consultant, ask your SD consultant to try the above approach.

entry.title: Blog: Managing Master Inspection Charactersitics (MICs) through ABAP
entry.content:
This post is still a work in progress...


In this blog post I will post an overview of how to manage MICs through an ABAP program
There are no dedicated BAPIs for MIC handling.

The FM 'BAPI_QPMK_SAVEREPLICA' will be used instead of various BAPIs to Create, Change and Delete MICs

Creating new MIC

Use FM 'BAPI_QPMK_SAVEREPLICA'
Input tables: 

  • MSTCHA (Master Characteristic Data)
    Key data for the MIC:
    • FUNCTION: Set to '009' for creating new MIC
    • PLANT_QPMK: Plant that MIC should be associated with
    • MSTR_CHAR: The Master Characteristic Number you want to be associated with the new MIC. 
      Find the number range setting in SPRO IMG → Quality Management → Quality Planning → Basic Data → Inspection Characteristic → Define Number Ranges. If a number range is maintained as internal then you can leave this field blank and that number range will be used. Otherwise use FM 'NUMBER_GET_NEXT' for object 'QMERKNR' and provide the interval key maintained in SNRO. 
    • VMSTR_CHAR: Version nr, set as '000001' for new MIC
    • VALID_FROM: Set as desired
    • QLOESCHKZ: Release status of MIC. Set as '2' for "released". Set as '1' for "Being created" if you do not want to release MIC immediately.
    • QVOLLST: Copy Model/Reference Characteristic. Initial for "Incomplete Copy Model", '1' for "Complete copy model" and 'X' for "Reference characteristic".
    • IND_CONTROL: This field represents the Characteristic Control Indicator selections. I have not found definitive documentation for how to de-/encode this field. I recommend having a template MIC and copying the corresponding QPMK-STEUERKZ field. 
  • MSTCHA_TEXT
    Text data for the MIC:
    • PLANT_QPMK; Provide the same plant as in the Key structure
    • MSTR_CHAR: Provide the same Master Characteristic Number as in the Key structure. If using an internal number range, you must pre-allocate it by calling the 'NUMBER_GET_NEXT' FM (OBJECT = 'QMERKMALE', SUBOBJECT = <plant>, NR_RANGE_NR = '<your internal interval>'). Remember to apply CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT.
    • VMSTR_CHAR: Provide the same version as in the Key structure
    • VALID_FROM: Provide the same valid from as in the Key structure
    • LANGU/LANGU_ISO: Provide the language that they text should be active for or leave blank for system language.
    • CHAR_DESCR: Provide short text
    • IND_MST_CHA_LTEXT: Flag whether long text exists

entry.title: Re: Unable to Update Bank Directories in Bulk
entry.content:
1. Use the Import Bank Directories app to upload bank directories in bulk.
  2. Upload the relevant files and compare them with the existing bank data.
  3. Save the new and modified data into the bank master table using a global bank directory.

entry.title: Re: Email notifications for the buyer when a Goods Receip...
entry.content:
Ensure Buyer Has a Valid Email in SAP User Master su01. Under Address, make sure the email address is maintained in the Communication section. If the buyer is not a SAP user, you’ll need to use a generic email address or create a dummy user with the correct email. In MN21, you can consider a Partner Function like PE or Created By. SAP then uses the partner data from the PO or GR document to identify the relevant user. If that user has a valid email address maintained in SU01, and the output method is set to External Send, the system routes the email accordingly.

Finally and most importantly, ensure Requirement 171 is assigned to MLGR in the procedure. This requirement ensures the output triggers only when a GR or SES is posted.

entry.title: Re: Alternative for Advanced Financial Closing
entry.content: Advanced financial closing can be time-consuming and complex, especially for companies managing large volumes of data. A practical alternative is adopting cloud-based automation tools that streamline reconciliation, reporting, and compliance. These tools reduce errors and improve accuracy in the closing cycle. Businesses also benefit from real-time dashboards and cross-department collaboration. Interestingly, even industries like iGaming use such technology to ensure transparency in transactions—see how platforms like https://icasinoreviews.co.nz/2-dollar-deposit-casino/ manage low-deposit systems effectively. entry.title: Missing point of configuration to assign the edocument type for FI-CA document type SAPPublic cloud
entry.content:
I have compared one on premise FI-CA configuration with public cloud.

In on premise there is one configuration point to assign the FI-CA document type to the edocument type that seems to be missing in Public cloud. The link in on premise SPRO is this one:

IMG/Funciones de aplicación generales/eDocument/Parametrizaciones generales/Assign eDocument Type to Accounting Document Type for FI-CA (TVFKEDOCV)

With the edocument type you can assign different types whenever the Invoice is an incoming invoice, outgoing invoice, adjustment invoice:

This configuration point, is not presented in SAP public cloud for FI-CA neither CI documents. It is just presented for FI and SD billing documents:

 

I’m not sure if we can activate any scope item in order to add this point of configuration for FI-CA documents. The scope items 5XU and 78L have been already activated.

In other hand, In the SAP documentation, I have found this:

Configuration Options for Key Users in Contract Accounting | SAP Help Portal

I can not see in this documentation where I can assign the edocument type for FI-CA.

Right now as I can not assign the edocument type, edocument is failing with the incoming invoices:

The system seems to be selecting for all the documents the SII Outgoing Invoice.

Could someone help me to see where can I assign the edocument type to the FI-CA document in SAP Public cloud?

Thanks

 

#FI-CA #BRIM  #CI #SAP PUBLIC CLOUD

entry.title: Re: Material Document Overview Fiori App features
entry.content: Do you know how I can manage a partial reverse of a material document?

entry.title: Re: Data Migration Cockpit - QM Inspection Plan PLKN (Gro...
entry.content:
Dear Yuri6542,

thank you for the details provided. 

The field PLNKN is an internal counter, there is no option to add/change it via transaction QP01/QP02 or via BAPI BAPI_INSPECTIONPLAN_CREATE either. As the migration object for inspection plan is based on the BAPI, it is not an option to update the PLNKN with the migration cockpit either. It should be assigned internally, automatically.

I wish you a nice day,
​Albert
​***
​Read and follow the 'SAP Community Rules of Engagement' at
​https://www.sap.com/community/about/rules-of-engagement.html

entry.title: Amazon Punchout integration with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have a scenario where I have to integrate Amazon Punchout with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system. I checked few Amazon Business documentation and they have provided process of integration with SAP Ariba and SAP SRM but not with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

I have below queries for this integration-

1. How the catalog data is called from SAP system as we do not have any store to maintain catalogs in SAP system

2. How the integration between Amazon and SAP will be done via SAP CPI. Is there any setup guide provided by SAP/Amazon?

Note - I have a set-up guide from Amazon, but few details like Network ID etc is missing in that ?

Please do let me know if anyone has done this integration with SAP S/4HANA System.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP Integration Suite

Thanks,

Aman Mittal

entry.title: Re: Auto suggestion in Simple Property
entry.content: Simple property doesn't have any look ahead suggestion capabilities.  The best suggestion might be to use a list picker with search.  Since it sounds like the value has to be a match you can display the list of users and as they start typing in the search the list will automatically filter down.

entry.title: Re: How to make ui5 scrollbar visible on focus?
entry.content: Personally, I'd reject making the scrollbar visible only on mouse hover due to a11y reasons. Reach out to UX experts whether what you're trying to achieve would be acceptable
